intro: Poranopsis discifera, commonly known as the disc-shaped poranopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive disc-like structure on its floral bracts. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical environments. Its flowers are usually small and tubular, often displaying vibrant colors that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
